summary: Create an e-commerce fashion website named VUURIX.

existing_features.title: Create the VUURIX fashion storefront with core pages: Home (hero + featured products), Product Listing (browse all), Category filtering, Product Detail (images, price, description, selectable size/color if available), Cart, and Checkout (collect shipping info and place an order).
Wire the frontend to the backend using React Query for loading product lists, product details, and order creation, including loading and error states.
Apply a coherent fashion-forward visual theme for VUURIX and enforce it consistently across the app (typography, spacing, buttons, cards, and page layout). Use English for all UI text.

Add generated static brand assets and placeholders for a polished MVP: VUURIX logo, a homepage hero banner, and a small set of product placeholder images; render them from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend image serving).
Add an admin-only Product Upload & Management page that lets an admin create, edit, and delete products in the VUURIX catalog (fields: name, price, description, category, image, sizes, colors).

Support adding product photos from the admin page by allowing either (a) entering an image URL or (b) selecting an image file that is converted to a data URL and stored in the product imageUrl field; show a preview before saving.
Add React Query hooks for admin product mutations (add, update, delete) and ensure product list queries are invalidated/refetched after successful mutations.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build VUURIX: an e-commerce website for fashion (storefront and shopping experience).

Implement product and order data models and canister APIs to support the storefront: store a catalog of fashion products (including name, description, price, category, image references, and optional variants like size/color) and allow creating and retrieving orders.
Add an admin Product Upload page/panel to allow uploading and managing clothing products (name, price, description, category, photos, sizes/colors).
Integrate the VUURIX website with Shopify (sync products/orders or use Shopify as backend).

Expose a simple backend query method that the frontend can use to determine whether the current caller is an admin, so the UI can conditionally show admin navigation entry points and guard admin pages.
